snippet: The candidates, the Republican Greg Abbott and the Democrat Wendy Davis, accused each other of benefiting from lax distribution of state development money.
abstract: Democrat Wendy Davis and Republican Greg Abbott, both vying to become governor of Texas, spar in their second and final televised debate over the state’s mismanagement of an economic-incentive fund.
lead_paragraph: The candidates, the Republican Greg Abbott and the Democrat Wendy Davis, accused each other of benefiting from lax distribution of state development money.

headline.main: Debate in Texas Governor’s Race Turns Heated Over Incentive Fund
headline.print_headline: Debate in Texas Governor’s Race Turns Heated Over Incentive Fund
